python101.name: Chapter 7: Loops
python101.content: Loops let you repeat code efficiently. Python mainly uses for loops (iterate over items) and while loops (repeat while a condition is true). You can also nest loops and control them with break, continue, and pass.

sections.title: What Are Loops?
sections.content:
Loops are used to run a block of code multiple times without copying it. Python has two primary loop types:

- for loops: step through items in a sequence
- while loops: repeat while a condition is True

sections.title: Basic for Loop
sections.explanation: The for loop goes through the list one item at a time and prints each name.

sections.title: Looping with Index (enumerate)
sections.explanation: enumerate gives both the index and the value, so you can use position and item together.

sections.title: While Loop Basics
sections.content:
counter = 1

while counter <= 3:
    print("Attempt", counter)
    counter += 1
sections.explanation: The loop runs while counter <= 3. After each iteration, counter increases by 1.

sections.title: Infinite Loop with break
sections.explanation: while True creates an infinite loop. The break statement exits the loop when the user types 'q'.

sections.title: Nested Loops
sections.explanation: The outer loop controls rows and the inner loop controls columns. You can nest for inside for, while inside for, etc.

sections.title: Loop Control Statements
sections.content:
Python provides special statements to control loop flow:

- continue: skip to the next iteration
- break: exit the loop early
- pass: do nothing (placeholder)

sections.title: Using continue
sections.content:
for n in range(1, 8):
    if n % 2 == 0:  # skip even numbers
        continue
    print(n)
sections.explanation: continue skips printing even numbers and goes straight to the next loop iteration.

sections.title: Using break
sections.explanation: The loop stops as soon as a negative value is found.

sections.title: Using pass
sections.explanation: pass is a no-op placeholder. The loop runs but does nothing inside the body.
